mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
Rainbow Six Siege - Loot box mechanics

After every won match, the player
has the chance to win a card.

For every chance that doesn't result
in a card, the probability to get a card
next time is increased.

After getting a new card, the probabilities
are reset to their defaults.

Lost matches do not influence
the probability in any way.
mxTextCell.prevLabel:
Rainbow Six Siege - Loot box mechanics

After every won match, the player
has the chance to win a card.

For every chance that doesn't result
in a card, the probability to get a card
next time is increased.

After getting a new card, the probabilities
are reset to their defaults.

Lost matches do not influence
the probability in any way.

mxTextCell.title: Text
mxTextCell.label:
The diagram simulates this system
and allows to set a target number of cards,
the "Cards Target" Register.

Once the cards are obtained, the End Condition
is triggered, and the "Matches Played" Pool
is an indicator of how long it would take
to achieve that number of cards.
